SENT.plain: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE: Various research protocols call for the vertebral artery (VA) occlusion
MATERIAL AND METHODS: The anterior aspect of the cervical spine was exposed, the small medial parts of two adjoining pedicles were removed and the VA was occluded by a small hemoclip
RESULTS: The vertebral artery was successfully occluded in 36 experimental animals
In 22 animals the occlusion was confirmed
CONCLUSIONS: The technique proved to be very reliable and rather easy
Its main advantage seems to be the possibility of simultaneous access to vertebral and carotid arteries
